channel.title: Comments on: WordPress 2.8 – XML-RPC and AtomPub Changes

item.title: By: Mutakhirkan WordPress ke Versi 2.8 | Aman
item.dc:creator: Mutakhirkan WordPress ke Versi 2.8 | Aman
item.description: [...] perubahan penting, berkaitan dengan XMLRPC dan ATOMPUB pada versi 2.8, yang bisa Anda simak di sini. Tidak kalah penting tentu saja adalah koleksi tip dan trik untuk WordPress versi teranyar ini. [...]
item.content:encoded: […] perubahan penting, berkaitan dengan XMLRPC dan ATOMPUB pada versi 2.8, yang bisa Anda simak di sini. Tidak kalah penting tentu saja adalah koleksi tip dan trik untuk WordPress versi teranyar ini. […]

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2009/06/10/wordpress-2-8-xml-rpc-and-atompub-changes/#comment-2838">timheuer</a>.
If you are seeing an extra line at the top of things I'd suspect your theme (or perhaps a plugin) that has an extra new line some where. If your theme has a functions.php file make sure that it isn't doing any direct output, including a new line character.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to timheuer.

If you are seeing an extra line at the top of things I’d suspect your theme (or perhaps a plugin) that has an extra new line some where. If your theme has a functions.php file make sure that it isn’t doing any direct output, including a new line character.

item.title: By: timheuer
item.dc:creator: timheuer
item.description: Joseph, have you seen issues in 2.8 were XMLRPC is adding an extra line at the top of the returns? It is causing issues for me on one of my sites http://cortinahoa.com/ and I see it in RSS output as well as the RSD output and any XMLRPC.php call.
item.content:encoded: Joseph, have you seen issues in 2.8 were XMLRPC is adding an extra line at the top of the returns? It is causing issues for me on one of my sites http://cortinahoa.com/ and I see it in RSS output as well as the RSD output and any XMLRPC.php call.
